title.bold: Steps for a grievance mechanism for internal stakeholders

list-item.p: Consult with workforce (e.g., focus group discussions on how such grievance mechanism should look so it is accessible, confidential, easy to use etc. and how it should be communicated, where and using what tools).
Write protocols (e.g., step by step approach, from report received, how an investigation is carried out and by who, ensuring a victim/survivor-based approach).
Offer support services (e.g., a referral mechanism is in place, with pre-identified support services).
Manage information (e.g., who will get access to what information at what time and how is information safely stored, considering a victim/survivor-based approach).
Build workforce knowledge (e.g., what is, why it is important to identify, act and proactively counter GBV, what is the grievance mechanism, and how it works).
Build key players capabilities (e.g., members of the workforce who receive complaints and investigate). Refer to paragraph A.4.2 for specificities of training.
Measure attitudes and practices (e.g., with surveys)
Measure effectiveness (e.g., use focus groups, track cases and how they are solved).
Measure workforce satisfaction (e.g., workforce satisfaction surveys)
